prompt:
I have the following gene expression data, "leukemiaExp.txt". The file is tab separated. The table has gene names on the first column. Each row is a gene and each column is a distinct sample. Filter genes based on their variability so we retain the most variable top 1000 genes. Based on these variable genes, plot a heatmap with clustering. Also plot PCA for samples.

response:
```
# Load required packages
library(ComplexHeatmap)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggplot2)
library(pcaMethods)

# Read the gene expression data
expression_data <- read.table("leukemiaExp.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t", row.names = 1)

# Calculate gene variability using standard deviation
gene_variability <- apply(expression_data, 1, sd)

# Get the top 1000 most variable genes
top_variable_genes <- names(sort(gene_variability, decreasing = TRUE))[1:1000]

# Filter the expression data based on the top variable genes
filtered_expression_data <- expression_data[top_variable_genes, ]

# Plot heatmap with clustering
heatmapplot <- Heatmap(filtered_expression_data, col = greenred(75), cluster_columns = TRUE, show_row_names = FALSE)

# Plot PCA for samples
pca_object <- pca(filtered_expression_data, method = "svdImpute", nPcs = 2)
pca_plot <- autoplot(pca_object, data = expression_data, colour = "Sample")
pca_plot <- pca_plot + ggtitle("PCA Plot") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

# Display the heatmap and PCA plot
heatmapplot
pca_plot
```
Note: Make sure to replace "leukemiaExp.txt" with the actual path or filename for the gene expression data file.
